hours: Monday: 8:00 AM - 11:59 PM Tuesday: 8:00 AM - 11:59 PM Wednesday: 8:00 AM - 11:59 PM Thursday: 8:00 AM - 11:59 PM Friday: 8:00 AM - 11:59 PM Saturday: 9:00 AM - 11:59 PM
materials: Glue & Adhesives; Antifreeze; Asbestos; Car; Automobile Parts; Brake Fluid; Brush; Lead Acid (Pb) Batteries; CD/DVD/Blu-ray/UHD discs; Compact Fluorescent Lights; Computer Monitors; Degreasers; Fertilizer; Fire Extinguishers; Fluorescent Lamps/Tubes; Fungicides; Gasoline and Unwanted Fuels; Grass Clippings; Herbicides; Household Cleaners; Insecticides; Leaves; Mercury Containing Items; Ni-Cd Batteries; Office Equipment; Unused Paint; Paint Thinner; Pesticides; Photography Chemicals; Pool Chemicals; Propane Tanks; Batteries (Rechargeable); Solvents; Televisions; Transmission Fluid; Tree Trimmings; Used Motor Oil; Oil Filters; Used Tires; VHS & Cassette Tapes; Weeds; Wood
notes: This site is located at the Addison Transfer Station.  District residents may bring most household hazardous waste (HHW) free of charge* to the HazWaste Center at the District Transfer Station. Please note that you must be a resident of one of the Districts 19 member towns to use the HazWaste Center. Fees apply to some electronics and other items.
